name: After-School Banana Bread Recipe
description: Total an hour | Active 15 minutesMakes 8 servingsTIP: I have a friend who replaces the pecans with a cup of chocolate chips. She has declared her variation heavenly, but I think my kids might find it to be another unwelcome riff on something they consider perfect just as it is. Nonetheless, I share this tip with you to encourage riffing of your own.

recipe_ingredient.note: Nonstick baking spray, for the pan
recipe_ingredient.display: Nonstick baking spray, for the pan

recipe_ingredient.note: 8 tablespoons (1 stick) salted butter, melted and cooled, plus softened butter for serving
recipe_ingredient.display: 8 tablespoons (1 stick) salted butter, melted and cooled, plus softened butter for serving

recipe_ingredient.note: 4 to 5 very ripe bananas, mashed (I like to leave them a little chunky)
recipe_ingredient.display: 4 to 5 very ripe bananas, mashed (I like to leave them a little chunky)

recipe_ingredient.note: 1/2 cup chopped pecans (optional; see Cook’s Note)
recipe_ingredient.display: 1/2 cup chopped pecans (optional; see Cook’s Note)

recipe_ingredient.note: 1 to 2 tablespoons granulated sugar as needed
recipe_ingredient.display: 1 to 2 tablespoons granulated sugar as needed

recipe_instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Spray an 8 x 8-inch pan with nonstick baking spray or line it with parchment paper.

In a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment (or in a large bowl with a handheld electric mixer), beat together the butter, brown sugar, eggs, and vanilla until well blended. Add the bananas and mix until combined.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and beat just until combined. Add the pecans (if using) and mix until combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread it evenly. Sprinkle the granulated sugar over the top. I like to cover the whole surface completely with sugar; use as much as you’d like.
Bake until a tester inserted in the center comes out clean, 45 to 50 minutes. Let the bread cool slightly in the pan on a rack. Slice and serve warm with butter.
When completely cooled, cover the pan with foil and store at room temperature for up to 2 days.
